# Acute metabolic encephalopathy:
Likely toxic metabolic encephalopathy given multiple insults 
listed above including hypotension, urinary tract infection, and 
severe acidosis. Utox/Stox negative. CT head without acute 
abnormality. TSH WNL.  She was maintained on delirium 
precautions.

# SVT
She was initially quite tachycardic up to 150s on xfer to floor. 
 This improved with treatment of above issues.  She was 
initiated on low dose beta blocker as well.

# DM2:
Takes sitagliptin, Lantus and Humalog at home. Glucose peaked in 
the 600s in the ED I/s/o D5W infusion with bicarb drip, then 
started on insulin drip with improvement in glucose to 209.
- Continued insulin sliding scale.

# NSTEMI:
Likely type 2 i/s/o septic shock and hypotension. She does have 
a CAD history s/p PCI in ___ in ___. EKG changes noted in 
the ED. Bedside ECHO in ED with appropriate EF and no 
pericardial effusion. Troponin elevation of 0.22 on admission, 
downtrending from OSH. No elevation CK-MB. Given degree of acute 
renal failure, this is likely type 2 NSTEMI. 
- Continued asa and statin and BB

# Chronic DVT:
I spoke with her PCP who feels that she still needs 
anticoagulation for DVT that she suffered while in rehab, 
unclear when. I will defer to his management.
